image_1.description: The French National Assembly, or lower house, is a legislative body in France where representatives elected by the people convene to make laws and oversee the government. It is the location where Prime Minister Élisabeth Borne informed lawmakers about the government's decision to raise the retirement age, facing heckling and opposition.

Élisabeth Borne is the Prime Minister of France who informed the National Assembly about the government's decision to raise the retirement age. She was met with heckling, booing, and vociferous chanting of the 'Marseillaise,' France’s national anthem, and had to wait for several minutes before being able to speak.

A group of individuals in the assembly are holding up signs that read '64 ANS C'EST NON!' and 'DEMOCRATIE.' They appear to be protesting against a proposed change in retirement age, as part of the tense confrontation over the measure to raise the retirement age to 64 from 62.

The podium is where the speaker, such as Prime Minister Élisabeth Borne, stands to address the National Assembly. It is ornately decorated with a golden emblem and serves as the central point for speeches and debates within the legislative body.
The signs held by the protestors in the assembly are white with black text, expressing dissent against a specific policy, particularly the government's decision to raise the retirement age.

Emmanuel Macron is the President of France who opted to pass legislation raising the retirement age without a full parliamentary vote, causing tension and controversy. His decision to ram the legislation through is certain to inflame an already tense confrontation over the measure.

image_3.description: Janet L. Yellen, Treasury Secretary, is a woman with white hair, wearing a black blazer and a patterned scarf, sitting at a desk with papers in front of her. She appears to be speaking or preparing to speak into a microphone and was involved in the call that led to the plan to inject $30 billion into First Republic Bank.
A polished wooden desk with papers and a microphone on it, where Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen is sitting, indicating she is addressing an audience or participating in a formal discussion.
